statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: ?? gets an sequence S with n intergers(0 < n <= 100000,0<= S[i] <= 1000000).?? has a magic so that he can change 0 to any interger(He does not need to change all 0 to the same interger).?? wants you to help him to find out the length of the longest increasing (strictly) subsequence he can get.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line contains an interger T,denoting the number of the test cases.(T <= 10)
For each case,the first line contains an interger n,which is the length of the array s.
The next line contains n intergers separated by a single space, denote each number in S.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output one line containing “Case #x: y”(without quotes), where x is the test case number(starting from 1) and y is the length of the longest increasing subsequence he can get.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case #1: 5
Case #2: 5


Hint
In the first case,you can change the second 0 to 3.So the longest increasing subsequence is 0 1 2 3 5.
